runs.comm: debutant Shannon Gabriel makes a swift start, and Chibhabha fends an inside edge to leg to open his account.
Sibanda is also off the mark straight away, pushing a 146kph delivery just wide of mid-on for a single.

well-timed! Chibhabha aims a neat little flick off his legs, and hits it well enough to beat Bravo at midwicket. Chibhabha is far more comfortable against spin, so sending him up the order is a good move.
Gabriel slips towards the pads once again, but this is too quick for Chibhabha and he can't get bat on it.
smell that! Gabriel digs in a very swift bouncer, the ball fizzing past Chibhabha's grille in a flash.
Gabriel finishes his first over with a full delivery that's dug out to mid-on's left.
immediately he looks less comfortable, leaning half forward to defend with no great certainty.
beaten on the cut! Chibhabha backs away, and attempts to attack the non-protected cover boundary, but is beaten by extra bounce.
this time he hits it! Again Chibhabha backed away, but the ball was fuller and he laced a drive in the air - but wide of a diving Pollard - and out to the boundary.
a third cut in a row, and it's stopped at point.
Badree loops this one up fulller and straighter, Chibhabha nudging towards short fine leg against the turn, such that it is.
and now Sibanda beaten on the cut! Sammy doesn't have a man out at deep cover, so the short might bring reward, but it's very risky.
Gabriel fires down a thunderbolt at Chibhabha's pads, the batsman beaten for pace and wearing it on the pad. Clearly slipping down leg.
shorter this time, and Chibhabha pulls with no great timing to midwicket.

short, and spooned in the air to short fine leg ... but Narine can't get to it! This was seriously quick, nudging 150kph, and Chibhabha didn't really see it. Fortunately for him, Narine couldn't get moving quickly enough to take the catch.
seriously quick once again, and they take a single as the ball stings Chibhabha's thigh and rolls to fine leg.
ouch, another stinging blow, this time to Sibanda. It was a length delivery, but he swiveled and tried to pull ... but the ball was onto him in a flash and hit him in the midriff.
another top-edged hook, but it falls safely again! Gabriel targeted Sibanda's throat, but the batsman swung hard and top-edged his shot out to the vacant long leg region.
too much risk! Chibhabha backs away once again, but Badree just fired this flat and straight and the ball rushed on to disturb the timber.
Masakadza nudges to midwicket.
flicked down to long on this time.
Sibanda is content to take the single on offer, turning a straight ball into the leg side.
speared in, nicely straight, and tapped back to the bowler.
glanced just wide of midwicket, and Sibanda calls Masakadza through for a quick single.
he's, as expected, pretty swift once again, this ball rising off a length to get Masakadza hopping in defense.
fuller this time, and Masakadza whips off the pad out to deep midwicket.

Sibanda will have bruises on his stomach and on his back! Gabriel pings him the first time with a short delivery, on the stomach, but Masakadza spots the chance for a cheeky single, and calls for a leg bye. Sibanda sprints to the other end, and is then hit on the back as Gabriel aims a shy at the stumps but hits the sprinting batsman instead! Sibanda, to his credit, still has a smile on his face, and Andre Russell gives him a friendly tap on the back. He's in the wars ...
gloved, but short of a diving Ramdin! Gabriel sent down another brutally quick delivery, too quick for Masakadza's pull at 147.6kph, but the ball fell to ground in front of a diving Ramdin.
Masakadza backs away, exposing all three stumps, and cracks a drive to extra cover.
Gabriel ends with a fairly harmless bouncer, too short and Masakadza is quickly underneath it. The batsman thinks it's a wide, but the umpire calls over.
Sibanda punches a single into the off side.
driven down to long off, where there's a man out.
hurled down the leg side as Sibanda tries to sweep, but misses. One more to the extras column.

gone! Sibanda, like Chibhabha before him, perishes trying to cut Badree. Unlike Chibhabha, he gets bat on the cut, but it's uppish and Bravo takes a good, stooping catch at point. He's pretty pleased by his own efforts, immediately setting off on a merry jig, but Sibanda is livid as he trudges off.
Taylor is immediately off the mark with a push down the ground.
pushed through quickly, and straight, and there's an appeal as Masakadza is hit on the pad, but it's clearly going down the leg side.

oh dear, Masakadza has ended up on his backside trying to sweep this! He lost his footing completely, but fortunately for him the ball went wide of Ramdin, so there wasn't a stumping danger as he scrambled back to his crease on all fours.
Taylor walks across his stumps and drives to long on.
wicket-to-wicket stuff from Sammy, and Masakadza turns the ball into the leg side.
Taylor is also content to milk the bowling, driving to long on.
a slower one is punched in the air towards long off, but goes to ground a good 20 metres in front of the fielder despite the call of "catch it!"
Taylor walks across his stumps again, and the ball comes off the inside half of the bat before rolling to midwicket.
drilled down the ground, Sammy sticks his foot out but he can't stop it.
Masakadza flicks across his pad, and against the spin, to find a single on the leg side.

a soft dismissal! Did this ball stop on Taylor? He just pushed forward at it, trying to place a drive through the on side but popping a very tame chance straight to Sammy at short extra cover off the leading edge. Zimbabwe slide further ...
Ervine is off the mark straight away, turning the ball off his toes.
crunched out through midwicket, but just the single.
Ervine, too, aims for midwicket, but on the opposite side.
punted down the ground, the ball bouncing down to Simmons.
a slower ball, and it's not picked! Masakadza was through his drive before the ball got to him, popping the ball in the air, but short of long off.
very straight, offering Ervine no width, but he finds a gap on the leg side for a single.
quicker one this time, and it's worked to leg.

a cheeky stroke, but an effective one! Ervine has played this shot a couple of times on this tour, opening the face of the blade at the very last moment to run a boundary down to third man. It's a good shot, with Ramdin up to the stumps and unlikely to take a catch.
and he does so, tucking the left-hander up.
nicely straight once again, and Ervine defends back down the track.
driven down to long on, with the spin.
Ervine gets well forward to drive to long off
chopped down behind square on the off side. Both gully and point sprint to the ball, but can't stop the single.
punched into the covers, and he finds the gap.
not picked! This one fairly spat up, and away, from Masakadza off a length. He didn't have a clue, but did at least manage not to edge it. It must be said, as well, that Ramdin took it really well.
edged this time! But through the vacant slip area and down to third man. Zimbabwe will take them any way they can get them.
Ervine makes room, but a length delivery rises past his poking bat.
angling across the left-hander, who chops it down towards gully.
very well-timed by Ervine, who seems to still be in decent form. Bravo pitched the ball up on his pads, and he threaded the gap at midwicket with a checked glance.
a slower one, and again it's not picked by Masakadza. He flails at the ball, one handed, but Russell - running in from deep midwicket - can't get to the ball before it reaches the ground.
nudged to cover point, Ervine stepping half forward and finding enough room for a single.
Masakadza heaves across the line at Bravo's quicker one, sending the ball rolling out to deep midwicket along the ground this time.
Masakadza is really struggling to pick Narine here. He sets himself in the crease and aims a full-blooded drive at this one but, expecting offspin, is beaten as the ball jags away from him.
that's one way to play him! Masakadza unfurls a reverse sweep, and finds the third man boundary.
Narine lands an offspinner well outside off, Masakadza leaning forward to tap gently into the gap at cover.
Ervine is cramped for room as this one rushes straight on, but his cut isn't stopped cleanly at point so they take a single.
punched to Sammy, at short extra cover, off the back foot.
Masakadza makes room, but the offspinner follows him and he can only mis-time his stroke back to the bowler.
Bravo comes round the wicket to Ervine, aiming a bouncer at his throat. Ervine isn't the strongest player of the pull, and fends the ball awkwardly to fine leg.

in the air ... but safe once again! Masakadza heaves desperately to leg, top-edging the ball into the breeze. Pollard charges in, but he can't get to it. Masakadza was probably saved by the wind there.
glanced off the pad, through square leg.
Ervine backs right away as Bravo runs in from round the wicket, but the ball is short and rises past his swishing blade.

this went miles in the air! Ervine backed away again, and aimed to hit a full delivery to midwicket. The slog was top-edged, however, going almost straight up. Bravo himself called for it, taking the catch right next to the non-striker's stumps. Barring a miracle, this game surely belongs to West Indies now, with Zimbabwe needing 91 from 43 balls and struggling to reach the boundary.
Masakadza fetches a full, wide delivery from outside off and slaps it down to long on.
a spooned drive loops up and over the cover fielder, but doesn't have the legs to reach the boundary.
the ball is looped down full, drawing Waller forward and then beating his outside edge as it cuts away from him.
a little too short this time, and Waller cuts to deep cover.
Masakadza comes forward to work the ball into the leg side. A single is called for, and Narine himself sprints across to field the ball.
sharp offspin! Waller stays deep in his crease, trying to read the ball off the pitch, but is beaten on the inside edge this time.
a leading edge balloons up ... but falls safely beyond cover, and they take a single.
Waller aims a firm short-arm jab out to deep midwicket, but finds the fielder in the deep.
Masakadza backs away and laces a cut straight to the point fielder.
short, and Masakadza steps back to pull to wide long on.
Waller stays back in his crease and chops the ball down close to cover for a quick single.
runs! Masakadza flays a full toss over extra cover for a one-bounce four to take Andre Russell's career T20I bowling average to a cool 200.
and another to end the over! It was a slower bouncer, but Masakadza picked it and bludgeoned a pull to wide long on.
Waller under-edges a cut straight into the ground, the ball bouncing through to Ramdin.
whipped across the line, the ball going to short fine leg.
Pollard digs this one in at his own feet, the ball ballooning over Masakadza's head as he barely bothers to duck. Bizarrely, not called wide.
Masakadza sets himself for a paddle-sweep, but ball hits pad instead to spark a high-pitched appeal from Pollard. It's hit the batsman well wide of off, however, and they run a leg bye.
punched through cover.
Masakadza backs away, but the ball ducks under his pulling bat.
drilled down the ground to end the over.

oh dear. Good shot, atrocious running. Waller spanks a handsome drive over extra cover, but turns and takes the second run very slowly ... the throw comes in, and the ambling batsman is caught well short of his crease. I think Waller just lost sight of the ball there. If he'd pushed harder, he'd have been home easily.
Mutombodzi is greeted with a bouncer, but it flies high down the leg side.
short, and rising as Mutombodzi hops to defend.
the slower ball this time, pitched right up to the bat. It's read by the new batsman, who drives to long on.
a slower ball yorker lands right at Masakadza's toes, and the best he can do is tap it back to the bowler.
an inside edge ricochets off the pad and rolls to short fine leg, allowing a single.
Mutombodzi is completely out-foxed by Bravo, who holds a simple catch. It was the slower one, and he was into the shot way too early. He lapped the ball almost straight up, and Bravo was under it.
a leading edge loops in the air, but lands short of point.
Utseya wants a tip-and-run single to cover point, but Masakadza sends him back.
Utseya finds the boundary! Narine offered him width outside off, and his cut found the gap behind point. All fairly academic at this point ...
looped up on off stump, poked to cover.
Utseya nudges defensively to point once again.
paddled to short fine leg, and they take a sharp single as Badree's shy goes wide.
Russell has Utseya ducking under a quick bouncer.
punched out through cover point off the back foot.
speared in at the toes, Masakadza just about manages to dig it out.
Masakadza swings hard outside off, bottom edging a yorker straight into the ground and down to third man for four. That also takes his strike rate up to a-run-a-ball.

and he goes to fifty straight afterwards! A limp length delivery outside off is crunched up and over cover, and bounces away to take Masakadza to his sixth T20I fifty. His team applaud the effort, though the match is gone from them.
dug in very short, and misdirected down the leg side. A clear wide.
and a better ball to finish, on a length and straight, and Masakadza defends.
sliced up and over point for a single.
Masakadza double steps and hammers a drive out to the cover sweeper.
a thick edge flies through the vacant slip area and down to third man.
slower ball from Barnwell, and it has the beating of Utseya outside off.
another slower one, out of the back of the hand, but Utseya reads this one and drives through cover.
Masakadza punts the final ball down the ground for a single to end the match.
